title: Windows 11 killed my 23 year old Firefox
content:
When I tried to open Firefox it said "Platform version :130.0.1 is not compatible with minVersion >= 130.0 maxVersion < 130.0

I would like to find the thousands of bookmarks I have saved over the years and get my old setup back up and running.

Thank you to anyone who can help.

Jim
creator: Jim462

title: Firefox motore di ricerca in Vivaldi
content: Ciao a tutti, Vorrei chiedere il vostro aiuto per inserire Firefox come motore di ricerca preferito in Vivaldi. Ciò è possibile ma non riesco a trovare l’indirizzo opportuno.
creator: clauango

title: Having an issue with Firefox and the Avada WordPress theme version 7.11.10
content: I've been using the Avada WordPress theme for years with no major issues. My latest install however, for a client, is version 7.11.10 and for some reason the right-click drop down contextual menu that allows you to copy a widget and paste it is no longer working in Firefox. I can bring up that right-click menu using Chrome, but all I see in Firefox are the crosshairs. In other Avada installs (version 7.11.5 and older), the menu works perfectly. I've checked with Avada Support and they're unable to replicate the issue in Firefox. Bizarre. It's a long shot, but I thought I'd see if anyone on here has encountered the same issue. I'm on a Mac.
creator: anne62

title: card games
content: how can I get solitair and casual card games
creator: frankiepenamancha45

title: Entire webpage
content:
A webpage contains text and pictures for 280 items. But the data and pictures for only 15 items are displayed on the monitor.

When I click on CTRL and F, the "Find" search-box is displayed where I enter the word or phrase to search for. But Firefox searches for the word/phrase only in what is displayed on the monitor.

When I drag the cursor beyond what is displayed on the monitor and do COPY, Firefox copies only what is displayed on the monitor.

How can I get Firefox to search or copy the entire webpage?

I have Windows 10 and Firefox 130.0.1 (64-bit)
creator: gcotterl

title: Size of Webpage's PICTURES
content:
When I click Ctrl and the minus/hyphen key, the size of the TEXT on the webpage is reduced but not the size of the PICTURES.

How can I reduce the size of both the TEXT and the PICTURES?

I have Windows 10 and Firefox 130.0.1 (64-bit)
creator: gcotterl

title: strange pop up when logging in
content:
When I log into Amazon, the ID is entered as usual. When the screen changes to enter the password an additional box opens up asking for a pin as shown in the attached image. It says it is from Windows security, but also says Firefox is making the request. None of the pins I know of work. Fortunately clicking on cancel clears the box and the PW can be entered.

Is Windows Security, Firefox, Password manager, anti-virus program, etc. generating the box. Would love to have it stop popping up. Suggestions please.
creator: prof.unblended695
